meanings.sent1: The lonely scarecrow stood shunned in the empty field.
meanings.sent2: The shunned puppy sadly watched the other dogs play together.
meanings.sent3: The shunned teddy bear decided to start its own tea party.
meanings.sent4: The old house on the hill had a shunned look, as if it held dark secrets.
meanings.sent5: The shunned book sat untouched on the dusty shelf, longing to be read.

meanings.definition: To keep away from; avoid deliberately.
meanings.sent1: She shunned the haunted house on the corner of the street.
meanings.sent2: The villagers shunned the stranger who arrived in town.
meanings.sent3: The cat shunned the new brand of cat food, turning up its nose at it.
meanings.sent4: He shunned the shortcut through the dark alley, fearing for his safety.
meanings.sent5: The detective shunned the obvious suspect, believing there was more to the case.

meanings.definition: To refuse to accept or consider.
meanings.sent1: The chef shunned the use of artificial ingredients in her recipes.
meanings.sent2: She shunned the offer to join the exclusive club, preferring her independence.
meanings.sent3: The student shunned the idea of studying for the test, hoping luck would suffice.
meanings.sent4: He shunned the advice of his friends, convinced he knew best.
meanings.sent5: The artist shunned traditional techniques, opting for a more experimental approach.
